transcript.text: Mark thinks about how to respond to the customer email. Would you know what to do in this situation? Select one option and then submit your answer.

contentText.text: If you write back to the customer asking for more information – like the name of their company and their position – is your email considered an export and would you know why?

instructionText.text: Select one option and then submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

optionContent.option: Yes, every email is potentially an export, since servers can be located in different countries, and so your email can cross many international borders
Yes, any email requesting information from someone in another country is always an export because you are receiving personal information
No, simply writing back to a customer to request more information is not an export

correct.text: In order to make sure you comply with the trade controls, you should write to the customer to learn more information.
However, simply sending this email is not an export, unless you also shared or attached design drawings, technology or other controlled product information.
